alert.note: Alert for St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 24 at 1:49AM CDT until May 24 at 6:45AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern St. Tammany Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Southern Hancock County in southern Mississippi... * Until 645 AM CDT. * At 149 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... New Orleans, Slidell, Bay St. Louis, Waveland, Diamondhead, Pearl River, Stennis Space Center, Pearlington, Lacombe, Kiln, Shoreline Park and Slidell Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 261 and 273. Interstate 12 between mile markers 63 and 84. Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 18. Interstate 59 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 10. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
